smtools.miscellaneous

Class TimeStamp

  • java.lang.Object
    • smtools.miscellaneous.TimeStamp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<TimeStamp>

    public final class TimeStamp
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<TimeStamp>
    The TimeStamp class acts as a container for time stamps.

    A time stamp is defined by its hour, minute, second and millisecond.

    Note that this class cannot be subclassed!

    Version:
    06/12/2011
    Author:
    Sven Maerivoet

      • TimeStamp

        public TimeStamp(int hour,
         int minute,
         int second)
        Constructs a TimeStamp object corresponding to the specified values.

        The millisecond is set to zero.

        Parameters:
        hour - the hour component
        minute - the minute component
        second - the second component
        See Also:
        TimeStamp(), TimeStamp(int,int,int,int), TimeStamp(long), TimeStamp(String), TimeStamp(TimeStamp)

      • TimeStamp

        public TimeStamp(long millisecondOfDay)
        Constructs a TimeStamp object corresponding to a number of milliseconds (since 00:00:00.000).
        Parameters:
        millisecondOfDay - the number of milliseconds (since 00:00:00.000) to convert to a TimeStamp object
        See Also:
        TimeStamp(), TimeStamp(int,int,int), TimeStamp(int,int,int, int), TimeStamp(String), TimeStamp(TimeStamp)

      • TimeStamp

        public TimeStamp(java.lang.String timeString)
          throws DateTimeFormatException
        Constructs a TimeStamp object corresponding to the specified string representation.

        The string has to have the following specific format:

          HH:mm:ss or HH:mm:ss.mls, e.g., 12:45:16 or 05:03:06.002
        Parameters:
        timeString - the string representation of the time stamp (in the format HH:mm:ss.SSS)
        Throws:
        DateTimeFormatException - if an error occurred during conversion
        See Also:
        TimeStamp(), TimeStamp(int,int,int), TimeStamp(long), TimeStamp(TimeStamp), SimpleDateFormat

      • TimeStamp

        public TimeStamp(TimeStamp timeStamp)
        Constructs a TimeStamp object as a copy of another TimeStamp object.

        This is the copy constructor.

        Parameters:
        timeStamp - the TimeStamp object to deep copy
        See Also:
        TimeStamp(), TimeStamp(int,int,int), TimeStamp(int,int,int, int), TimeStamp(long), TimeStamp(String)

      • convertBetweenTimeZones

        public void convertBetweenTimeZones(DateStamp date,
                           java.util.TimeZone fromTimeZone,
                           java.util.TimeZone toTimeZone)
        Converts this TimeStamp object from one time zone to another. Note that daylight savings are taken into account when applicable. Time zones can be obtained via, e.g., TimeZone.getTimeZone("Europe/Brussels").
        Parameters:
        date - the DateStamp of this TimeStamp object
        fromTimeZone - the TimeZone to convert from
        toTimeZone - the TimeZone to convert to

      • convertFromLocalTimeZoneToUTC

        public void convertFromLocalTimeZoneToUTC(DateStamp date)
        Converts this TimeStamp object from the user's local time zone to UTC. Note that daylight savings are taken into account when applicable.
        Parameters:
        date - the DateStamp of this TimeStamp object

      • convertFromTimeZoneToUTC

        public void convertFromTimeZoneToUTC(DateStamp date,
                            java.util.TimeZone fromTimeZone)
        Converts this TimeStamp object from a time zone to UTC. Note that daylight savings are taken into account when applicable.
        Parameters:
        date - the DateStamp of this TimeStamp object

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String timeString)
         throws DateTimeFormatException
        Sets this TimeStamp object corresponding to the specified string representation.

        The string has to have the following specific format:

          HH:mm:ss or HH:mm:ss.mls, e.g., 12:45:16 or 05:03:06.002
        Parameters:
        timeString - the string representation of the time stamp (in the format HH:mm:ss or HH:mm:ss.SSS)
        Throws:
        DateTimeFormatException - if an error occurred during conversion
        See Also:
        SimpleDateFormat
